name: Dyslipidemia CKD Workflow
description: CKD including those treated with Chronic Dialysis or Kidney Transplant

children.name: Prior lipid profile?
children.description:
1. In adults with newly identified CKD (including those treated with chronic dialysis or kidney transplantation), we recommend evaluation with a lipid profile (total cholesterol, LDL cholesterol, HDL cholesterol, triglycerides). (1C)
2. In adults with CKD (including those treated with chronic dialysis or kidney transplantation), follow-up measurement of lipid levels is not required for the majority of patients. (Not Graded)
children.inputForm: Prior measurement of lipid profile:

condition.label: prior lipid profile
condition.description: Established CKD with previous measurement of lipid profile.

children.name: Followup Lipid Profile
children.description: Follow-up measurement of LDL-C (or entire lipid profile) should be reserved for instances where the results would alter management.

children.name: Suspect secondary dyslipidemia cause?
children.description: Do you suspect the patient has developed a new secondary cause of dyslipidemia?
children.inputForm: Suspect secondary dyslipidemia cause?:

children.name: Followup lipid profile
children.description: Follow-up measurement of the lipid profile is suggested.

children.name: Already on statins?
children.description: Is the patient already on a statin?
children.inputForm: Already on statins?:

children.name: No followup
children.description: No follow-up measurement of the lipid profile is suggested.

children.name: Reassessing 10 year CV risk?
children.description: Are you reassessing 10 year CV risk to look for an indication for statin treatment?
children.inputForm: Reassessing 10 year CV risk?:

children.name: Followup lipid profile
children.description:
Some patients may prefer to know their levels: therefore, the need for follow-up can be assessed on a per-patient basis. 
	However, there is no evidence to followup lipid profile.

children.name: No followup
children.description: No follow-up measurement of the lipid profile is suggested.

children.name: Age?
children.inputForm: yearAge? (1-120)

children.name: eGFR value?
children.inputForm: ml/min/ 1.73m2eGFR value? (1-200)

children.name: treat with statins
children.description: 2.1.2: In adults aged >=50 years with CKD and eGFR>=60 ml/min/1.73m2 (GFR categories G1-G2) we recommend treatment with a statin. (1B)
children.insert:
Contra-indications for statins:
  • Active liver disease, high alcohol consumption or pregnancy.
  • Women with childbearing potential should only use statin if there is reliable contraception.

Recommended doses of statins in adults with CKD

Statin
eGFRestimated glomerular filtration rate
G1 - G2 (details)
eGFRestimated glomerular filtration rate
G3a - G5
**incl. dialysis or kidney transplant patients
(details)
(60 to >=90 ml/min/1.73m²) (up to 59 ml/min/1.73m²)
Lovastatin
GPgeneral population
ndnot done or not studied
Fluvastatin
GPgeneral population
 80
1Data based on ALERT.
mg/d
Atorvastatin
GPgeneral population
 20
2Data based on 4D.
mg/d

GPgeneral population

3Data based on AURORA.
mg/d
Simvastatin/Ezetmibe
GPgeneral population
 20 / 10
4Data based on SHARP.
mg/d
Pravastatin
GPgeneral population
 40 mg/d
Simvastatin
GPgeneral population
 40 mg/d
Pitavastatin
GPgeneral population
 2 mg/d

** incl. dialysis or kidney transplant patients.

All statins may not be available in all countries. Lower doses than those used in major trials of statins in CKD populations may be appropriate in Asian countries. Note that rosuvastatin 40mg daily is not recommended for use in CKD 1-2 non- transplant patients, as it may increase the risk of adverse renal events. Cyclosporin inhibits the metabolism of certain statins resulting in higher blood levels. Data based on 1ALERT, 24D, 3AURORA, 4SHARP. Abbreviations: eGFR, estimated glomerular filtration rate; GP, general population; nd, not done or not studied.

children.name: Kidney transplant?
children.inputForm: Kidney transplant?:

children.name: treat with statins
children.description: 2.4: In adult kidney transplant recipients, we suggest treatment with a statin. (2B)
children.insert:
Contra-indications for statins:
  • Active liver disease, high alcohol consumption or pregnancy.
  • Women with childbearing potential should only use statin if there is reliable contraception.

children.name: Using statins or statin/ezetimibe?
children.inputForm: Using statins or statin/ezetimibe?:

children.name: continue statin or statin/ezetimibe
children.description: 2.3.2: In patients already receiving statins or statin/ezetimibe combination at the time of dialysis initiation, we suggest that these agents be continued. (2C)
children.insert:
Contra-indications for statins:
  • Active liver disease, high alcohol consumption or pregnancy.
  • Women with childbearing potential should only use statin if there is reliable contraception.

children.name: do not initiate statins
children.description: 2.3.1: In adults with dialysis-dependent CKD, we suggest that statins or statin/ezetimibe combination not be initiated. (2A)

children.name: Age?
children.inputForm: yearAge? (1-120)

children.name: assess CV risk
children.description: Note that CV risk should be re-assessed on an annual basis, as changes in clinical condition may warrant treatment with a statin.
children.inputForm: %Likelihood of non-fatal MI (calculate) (1-100)

children.name: treat with statin

condition.label: high risk
condition.description:
Prior MI or
Prior Coronary revascularization or
Prior ischemic stroke or Transient ischemic attack or
Diabetes or
Estimated 10-year incidence of coronary death or non-fatal MI >10% using a validated risk calculator

children.description:
2.2: In adults aged 18–49 years with CKD but not treated with chronic dialysis or kidney transplantation, we
suggest statin treatment in people with one or more of the following (2A):
•	known coronary disease (myocardial infarction or coronary revascularization)
•	diabetes mellitus
•	prior ischemic stroke
•	estimated 10-year incidence of coronary death or non-fatal myocardial infarction >10%
children.insert:
Contra-indications for statins:
  • Active liver disease, high alcohol consumption or pregnancy.
  • Women with childbearing potential should only use statin if there is reliable contraception.

Recommended doses of statins in adults with CKD

children.name: Statins prescribed?
children.description: Were any statins prescribed for cholesterol lowering treatment?
children.inputForm: Any statins prescribed for cholesterol lowering treatment?:

children.name: Check Fasting Serum TGs Values
children.inputForm: mmol/LFasting serum TGs value (1-100)

children.name: Malnutrition?
children.inputForm: Malnutrition?:

children.name: Judicious lifestyle changes
children.description: Prescribe Therapeutic Lifestyle Changes judiciously with caution.

children.name: Check Fasting Serum TGs Values (2)
children.inputForm: mmol/LFasting serum TGs value (1-100)

children.name: Avoid nicotinic acid
children.description: Nicotinic Acid has not been well studied in advanced CKD and therefore is not recommended for the treatment of severe hypertriglyceridemia.

children.name: Prevent pancreatitis?
children.description: Have a conversation with patient regarding pros and cons of treatment with statin vs. fibric acid derivatives and their preference, especially regarding prevention of pancreatitis. (Concomitant therapy with fibric acid derivative and a statin is not recommended in patient with CKD due to the potential for toxicity.)
children.inputForm: Does the patient place high value on preventing pancreatitis?:

children.name: Prescribe fibric acid

condition.label: yes
condition.description: Patient places high value on preventing pancreatitis.

children.description:
Fibric acid derivatives could be considered. 
	If considered, fibric acid should be dose adjusted for kidney function. 
	Fibric acid derivatives might be warranted in patients who place a relatively high value in preventing pancreatitis and a relatively low value on the risk of CV disease.

children.name: No fibric acid

condition.label: no
condition.description: Patient does not place high value on preventing pancreatitis.

children.description: Fibric acid derivatives should not be considered.

children.name: Lifestyle changes
children.description:
Prescribe Therapeutic Lifestyle Changes:
•	Low Fat diet (<15% total calories)
•	Reduce monosaccharides & disaccharides intake
•	Reduce total amount of dietary carbohydrates
•	Use fish oils to replace some long-chain TGs

condition.label: no profile
condition.description: Newly identified CKD or established CKD with no prior measurement of lipid profile.

children.name: Measure lipid profile
children.description:
1.	Total cholesterol
2.	LDL cholesterol 
3.	HDL cholesterol 
4.	Triglycerides
children.inputForm: Abnormal lipid profile?:

children.name: No action
children.description: No further measurement of lipid profile.

children.name: Rule out secondary causes
children.description: Investigate and treat remediable secondary causes of dyslipidemia.

children.name: Treatment or referral
children.description: Remediable (secondary) causes of dyslipidemia found. Treat secondary causes or refer to specialist.

children.name: No secondary causes
children.description: No remediable (secondary) causes of dyslipidemia found.

children.name: Evaluate severity dyslipidemia
children.description: Assess fasting triglycerides and LDL-C
children.inputForm:
mmol/LFasting triglycerides (1-100)
mmol/LLDL cholesterol (1-100)

children.name: Referral

condition.label: severe
condition.description:
1.Fasting Triglycerides > 11.3mmol/l (1000 mg/dl); or
2. LDL-C > 4.9 mmol/l(190 mg/dl)

children.description: Consider referral to a specialist for further evaluation.

children.name: Followup Lipid Profile

condition.label: not severe
condition.description:
1.Fasting Triglycerides <= 11.3mmol/l (1000 mg/dl); and
2. LDL-C <= 4.9 mmol/l(190 mg/dl)

children.description: Follow-up measurement of LDL-C (or entire lipid profile) should be reserved for instances where the results would alter management.

children.name: Suspect secondary dyslipidemia cause?
children.description: Do you suspect the patient has developed a new secondary cause of dyslipidemia?
children.inputForm: Suspect secondary dyslipidemia cause?:

children.name: Followup lipid profile
children.description: Follow-up measurement of the lipid profile is suggested.

children.name: Already on statins?
children.description: Is the patient already on a statin?

children.description: No follow-up measurement of the lipid profile is suggested.

children.description: Nicotinic Acid has not been well studied in advanced CKD and therefore is not recommended for the treatment of severe hypertriglyceridemia.

children.name: Prevent pancreatitis?
children.description: Have a conversation with patient regarding pros and cons of treatment with statin vs. fibric acid derivatives and their preference, especially regarding prevention of pancreatitis. (Concomitant therapy with fibric acid derivative and a statin is not recommended in patient with CKD due to the potential for toxicity.)
children.inputForm: Does the patient place high value on preventing pancreatitis?:

children.name: Prescribe fibric acid

condition.label: yes
condition.description: Patient places high value on preventing pancreatitis.

children.description:
Fibric acid derivatives could be considered. 
	If considered, fibric acid should be dose adjusted for kidney function. 
	Fibric acid derivatives might be warranted in patients who place a relatively high value in preventing pancreatitis and a relatively low value on the risk of CV disease.

children.name: No fibric acid

condition.label: no
condition.description: Patient does not place high value on preventing pancreatitis.

children.description: Fibric acid derivatives should not be considered.

children.name: Lifestyle changes
children.description:
Prescribe Therapeutic Lifestyle Changes:
•	Low Fat diet (<15% total calories)
•	Reduce monosaccharides & disaccharides intake
•	Reduce total amount of dietary carbohydrates
•	Use fish oils to replace some long-chain TGs
